abstract: Obama administration cuts long-term insurance program created as part of health care law to help people with chronic and severe disabilities, saying that the premiums would be too costly and program would not work; decision is another setback for health insurance legislation, which is under attack in court, in Congress and in many state legislatures.
snippet: The Obama administration says a long-term care program, known as Class, would be too costly.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration says a long-term care program, known as Class, would be too costly.

headline.main: Health Law to Be Revised by Ending a Program
headline.print_headline: Health Law To Be Revised By Ending A Program
headline.seo: Long-Term Care Program Cut From Health Law
